bug.short_desc: Evaluate if event handler registration can be optimized

long_desc.thetext:
In the qx.bom.Element class all event handler are registered by using the #require statement.
#require(qx.event.dispatch.Direct) #require(qx.event.dispatch.DomBubbling) #require(qx.event.handler.Keyboard) #require(qx.event.handler.Mouse) #require(qx.event.handler.DragDrop) #require(qx.event.handler.Element) #require(qx.event.handler.Appear) #require(qx.event.handler.Touch)
The event handler classes in qx.event.handler.* do require special event handler as well.
Some things to think about:
* Some applications won't need all handler (e.g. when the app has no keyboard / mouse / DragDrop / interaction) * Some applications won't need the event handler during application startup, but will need qx.html.Element for element creation. As soon as the GUI is started and the user can interact, the listeners are needed. * Where is a better place for the event handler registration? Skeleton (=myapp.Application)? Config? Generator detection which events are used?
